intro: Cnidium ajanense, commonly known as the African snake root, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, with a distinctive, somewhat hairy texture. Cnidium ajanense is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
